project.teaser: The European plastics policy highlights bio-based plastics as a key piece to solve the negative impact of fossil-based plastics in the environment. One of the most promising biodegradable biopolymers is the polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHAs) family that can replace these...
project.objective: The European plastics policy highlights bio-based plastics as a key piece to solve the negative impact of fossil-based plastics in the environment. One of the most promising biodegradable biopolymers is the polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHAs) family that can replace these fossil-based plastics in many applications. They are synthesised by microorganisms from renewable carbon sources and exhibit good properties and excellent biodegradability. In this sense, ViSS project will create a new value chain around PHBV (a copolymer of the PHAs family) as a safe, sustainable, and cost-effective alternative to conventional plastics, especially for short shelf-life food packaging applications due to its excellent properties including flexibility, processability, recyclability and biodegradability in relevant environments (soil, freshwater, marine, industrial composting and home composting). ViSS PHBV will be produced from industrial organic residues and will be formulated and compounded to be transformed and validated as high-performance food packaging, being mechanically recyclable and biodegradable. Moreover, the whole ViSS circular value chain will be constructed upon a collaborative approach and under safe and sustainable criteria, accomplishing EU regulations and ensuring policy alignment, while the project will deliver and disseminate digital tools and resources which will favour an increased social readiness and marketability of bio-based plastics, fostering a ViSS wide adoption and replication. Our project gathers 15 partners from 6 European countries leaders in different fields of knowledge, from bioplastic production to validation in real packaging applications. Adoption of ViSS value chain will produce relevant outcomes as improved functionalities and environmental performances: reduction of 57.8% of CO2 emissions compared to fossil counterparts, yearly saving 11.7 kt of crude oil, recirculating 288.95 kt of biomass, avoiding the use of 2.2 kt of hazardous substances.
project.title: Viable, safe and sustainable PHBV value chain for food packaging applications
project.keywords: Bio-based plastics, biodegradable plastics, polyhydroxyalkanoates, PHBV, food packaging, flexible packaging, safe and sustainable, bioplastics compounding, bioplastics recyclability

article.title: Safe and sustainable bio-based plastic packaging

result.title: Preliminary Data Management Plan
result.description: Preliminary description of the data management strategy for the all the data collected, processed and generated during the project life cycle. (Related task: task 8.3, WP8)

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ViSS (Viable, safe and sustainable PHBV value chain for food packaging applications)
result.teaser: The ViSS project addresses the critical need for sustainable alternatives to fossil-based plastics, aiming to decarbonize society by establishing sustainble bio-based plastic value chains. While some bioplastics exist, many lack full recyclability and biodegradability, and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Working title: Effect of saccharide additives on PHBV secondary crystallisation

details.journalTitle: Master’s Programme in Theoretical and Computational Methods

result.title: ViSS Final Residues Management Plan
result.description: Procedures for the collection, transportation, storage and hygienic conditions of the residues used as feedstocks during WP1 and WP2 activities. (Related task: task 1.2, WP1)

result.title: ViSS Preliminary Residues Management Plan
result.description: Initial protocol for the management of the residues according to the specifications and residues characteristics defined in the kick off meeting. (Related task: task 1.2, WP1)

result.title: First sustainable by design assessment
result.description: First assessment of project sustainability including data from the first 18 months of the project for screening LCA and , LCC and s-LCA. It also includes the selected adequate monitoring framework for the circularity quantitative assessment. (Related task: task 6.4, WP6)

result.title: Project management
result.description: Project management guideline & Quality plan, including collaboratiave platform for data sharing. (Related task: task 8.1, WP8)

result.title: First report on public engagement actions
result.description: Report on the public engagement activities carried out during the first 18 months, including objectives, techniques and key activities to engage the quadruple helix of stakeholders in ViSS activities. (Related task: task 7.3, WP7)

result.title: ViSS non-sensitive ICT Platform
result.description: ViSS Evaluation & Decision Tool and Public Tool. (Related task: task 6.1.1, WP6)

result.title: First report on dissemination & communication
result.description: Respective actions carried out and their impact analysis. Also includes the actions carried out for networking and clustering activities. (Related task: task 7.2 and 7.4, WP7)

result.title: SSbD and Social Readiness evaluation framework (SRL)
result.description: Includes the results of the application of the 2-round delphi method, the SSbD and Social Readiness evaluation matrix and the prioritised factors which will be translated into a Scoring System. (Related task: task 6.2, WP6)

result.title: First report on capacity building resources and actions
result.description: Capacity building actions and recommendations delivered during the first 18 months of the project. (Related task: task 7.5, WP7)

result.title: First safety by design assessment
result.description: Initial identification of hazards and risks at material, process, product and at end-of life levels (first 18 months of the project). D6.6 includes IAS and NIAS assessment, QSAR, QSPR and mathematical models developments. (Related task: task 6.3, WP6)

result.title: Public Engagement strategy
result.description: Objectives, techniques and key activities to engage the quadruple helix of stakeholders in ViSS activities. (Related task: task 7.3, WP7)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
